result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher J Brown

records.addlTxt: Authorization to appear received and filed.

Letter from Dr. Niess to the Court requesting an extension of the deadline to complete the competency report for the defendant.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/26/2022 - The Court will address this at the hearing on 11/7. Mr. Brown must appear in person, or a warrant will issue.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Signed competency order

Per staff at Wisconsin Forensic Unit, unable to contact defendant by phone - letter mailed to him instead.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

2:05 PM Defendant Kristopher J Brown in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court notes an order for competency was ordered on 22CM1642.  For today's purposes, the Court will extend the competency report to this case as well.  COURT ORDERS FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  The defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
